taskbody.context:
Use this procedure to create a thin pool for application data storage, and to configure the master host to use it. The following configuration variables are used to specify application data thin pools:
This procedure does not include a specific value for the size of the thin pool. For more information about sizing this resource, refer to the documentation for your application. Or, use the suggested minimum value, 200GB. You can add storage to an LVM thin pool at any time.
Perform these steps:

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Create an LVM thin pool for application data.
step.info: For more information about the serviced-storage command, see .
step.stepxmp: Replace Value with the fixed or relative amount of space to use for the thin pool; and replace Storage with the paths of one or more block devices or partitions, or the name of an LVM volume group: serviced-storage create-thin-pool --size=Value serviced Storage
step.stepresult: On success, the result is the device mapper name of the thin pool, which always starts with /dev/mapper.

step.cmd: Identify the size of the thin pool for application data.
step.info: The size is required to set an accurate value for the SERVICED_DM_BASESIZE variable.

step.cmd: Make a backup copy of the configuration file.

substep.cmd: Set the backup file permissions to read-only.

step.cmd: Edit storage variables in the configuration file.

substep.cmd: Locate the line for the SERVICED_FS_TYPE variable, and then make a copy of the line, immediately below the original.
Add SERVICED_DM_THINPOOLDEV immediately after SERVICED_FS_TYPE, and set its value.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Thin-Pool-Name with the device mapper name of the thin pool for application data: SERVICED_DM_THINPOOLDEV=Thin-Pool-Name

substep.cmd: Add SERVICED_DM_BASESIZE immediately after SERVICED_DM_THINPOOLDEV, and set its value.

stepxmp.p: Replace Fifty-Percent with the value that is less than or equal to 50% of the size of the thin pool for application data. Include the symbol for gigabytes, G:

taskbody.postreq: Proceed to the next chapter and configure the host.
